episodeTitle: A New Chapter Begins - The Straw Hat Crew Reunites!
episodeTitleJapanese: 新章開幕 再集結！麦わらの一味
episodeTitleRomanized: Shinshō Kaimaku - Saishūketsu! Mugiwara no Ichimi
description: After two years of separation and intensive training, the Straw Hat Pirates begin reuniting at Sabaody Archipelago. However, their long-awaited reunion is complicated by the appearance of a gang of imposters claiming to be the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: New Chapter Opening Narration
events.description: The episode opens with a new narration that marks the beginning of the second half of One Piece. The narrator discusses the dawning of a new pirate era following Gold Roger's execution, mirroring the original opening narration but signaling a fresh start for the post-timeskip era.
events.significance: This narration signals the beginning of the series' second half after 516 episodes. It's the first time the opening narration has been updated, emphasizing the importance of this turning point in the story.

events.title: Luffy Departs Ruskaina Island
events.description: After two years of intense training on the deserted island of Ruskaina, Luffy reclaims his straw hat from Rayleigh's care and prepares to depart. He bids farewell to the wild animals he trained alongside and sets off to reunite with his crew.
events.significance: Marks the end of Luffy's two-year training period and the beginning of his journey to reunite with his crew. This moment symbolizes Luffy's readiness to tackle the New World with his enhanced abilities.

quotes.text: I'm ready. Time to set sail again!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his readiness after completing his training

events.title: Hancock's Farewell to Luffy
events.description: Boa Hancock and the Kuja Pirates arrive to escort Luffy to Sabaody Archipelago. Hancock has prepared half a year's worth of supplies and gives Luffy a disguise. When she asks him to marry her, Luffy politely declines but expresses gratitude for her help.
events.significance: Shows the continuing relationship between Luffy and Hancock, and her unrequited love for him. Demonstrates Luffy's obliviousness to romance while maintaining respect for his allies.

quotes.text: Thank you for the food, but I don't want to marry you.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's straightforward response to Hancock's marriage proposal

events.title: Zoro Arrives First at Sabaody
events.description: The sun sets over Sabaody Archipelago as Rayleigh and Shakuyaku discuss the pending arrival of the Straw Hat Pirates at Shakky's bar. The door suddenly opens and Roronoa Zoro appears - miraculously, he is the first crew member to arrive despite his notorious poor sense of direction.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' reunion. The irony of Zoro arriving first despite his directional challenges provides comic relief while showing his determination to honor the promise.

quotes.text: You're the first one here, Zoro.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh's surprise at Zoro being the first to arrive

events.title: Post-Timeskip Zoro Design Debut
events.description: Zoro's new post-timeskip appearance is revealed. He now has a scar over his left eye which remains closed, short hair, and wears a black scarf on his left arm. His overall appearance is more muscular and battle-hardened.
events.significance: First reveal of a Straw Hat's post-timeskip design. Zoro's scarred eye becomes one of the series' enduring mysteries. His enhanced physique hints at the intensive training he underwent with Mihawk.

events.title: Fake Straw Hat Crew Debuts
events.description: The Fake Straw Hat Crew led by 'Three-Tongued' Demaro Black (impersonating Luffy) begins recruiting pirates at Sabaody Archipelago. They claim to be the real Straw Hat Pirates and use the crew's reputation to gather followers for their conquest of the New World.
events.significance: Introduces the primary antagonists of the Return to Sabaody arc. The imposters' existence shows how legendary the Straw Hats have become during their two-year absence.

quotes.text: I'm Monkey D. Luffy, and I'm recruiting strong pirates to conquer the New World!
quotes.speaker: Demaro Black

events.title: Caribou and Coribou Bounties Revealed
events.description: The notorious rookie brothers 'Wet Hair' Caribou and 'Blood-Splatterer' Coribou are revealed to have bounties of 210,000,000 and 190,000,000 berries respectively. They join the Fake Straw Hat crew with the secret intention of killing the real Straw Hats from the inside.
events.significance: Introduces two new rookie pirates with significant bounties. Their deceptive recruitment foreshadows future complications and establishes them as serious threats.

events.title: Post-Timeskip Nami Design Debut
events.description: Nami arrives at Sabaody Archipelago with her new post-timeskip appearance. She has longer hair, a more mature figure, and wears a bikini top with jeans. She is approached by the Fake Straw Hats who try to recruit her, not realizing she is the real Nami.
events.significance: Reveals Nami's new design and establishes her growth during the timeskip. Her encounter with the fakes sets up the confrontation between real and fake crew members.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami refuses the Fake Straw Hats' offer

events.title: Post-Timeskip Usopp Design Debut
events.description: Usopp arrives at Sabaody with his new muscular build, beard, and longer hair. He confidently confronts the Fake Straw Hats who are harassing Nami. Using his enhanced weapon, he demonstrates his improved marksmanship.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's dramatic physical transformation and increased confidence. His muscular physique and new attitude reflect his training on the Boin Archipelago.

quotes.text: Nami! I'm glad to see you!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Nami and Usopp Confront Fake Straw Hats
events.description: When the Fake Sogeking fires at Usopp and misses, Nami recognizes the imposters. She and Usopp prepare to deal with the fake crew members who are tarnishing their reputation.
events.significance: First direct confrontation between real and fake Straw Hats. Shows the real crew members' confidence in handling threats.

events.title: Post-Timeskip Sanji Design Debut
events.description: Sanji arrives on Sabaody being chased by several okama from Kamabakka Kingdom. He has a beard and his hair now covers both eyes. Despite his ordeal with the okamas, he immediately notices a woman and chases after her with hearts in his eyes.
events.significance: Reveals Sanji's new look and confirms his personality hasn't changed despite his traumatic training. His continued pursuit of women provides comic relief.

events.title: Post-Timeskip Robin Design Debut
events.description: Nico Robin arrives at Sabaody wearing a long skirt and sunglasses, avoiding mysterious pursuers. She wonders about Brook's concert and the Fake Straw Hat recruitment posters she's seen around the island.
events.significance: Shows Robin's new mature appearance and her awareness of the situation on Sabaody. Her observation skills help piece together what's happening.

events.title: Post-Timeskip Franky Design Debut
events.description: Franky appears at the Thousand Sunny with his drastically altered cyborg body. He is much larger and more mechanical, with a new hairstyle and enhanced features. He confirms the ship is undamaged and ready for their departure.
events.significance: Reveals Franky's shocking transformation into a more advanced cyborg. His upgrade of the Thousand Sunny for underwater travel sets up their journey to Fish-Man Island.

quotes.text: The Sunny is all set to go!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky confirms the ship is ready

events.title: Post-Timeskip Chopper Design Debut
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper walks through Sabaody eating a Grand Bun, commenting on how good it tastes. He appears smaller in his standard form and gets excited when he finds a cotton candy vendor. Due to his cute appearance, people still don't recognize him as a pirate.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's new cuter appearance, which ironically makes him even less threatening. His innocent enjoyment of the island contrasts with the brewing conflict.

events.title: Post-Timeskip Brook Design Debut and Concert
events.description: Brook performs his final concert as 'Soul King' Brook after completing a world tour during the two years. He has become a famous rock star and is pursued by adoring fans and Marines. He performs his song 'Bone to Be Wild' for the crowd.
events.significance: Reveals Brook's celebrity status and his new role as a famous musician. His world tour success shows how he used the timeskip productively to gain fame while waiting to reunite.

events.title: Introduction of New Eyecatchers
events.description: The episode features the debut of the third set of eyecatchers (commercial break cards) showing the Straw Hat members' post-timeskip designs. Luffy's post-timeskip eyecatcher is shown for the first time.
events.significance: Marks a visual milestone in the series, emphasizing the new era. The eyecatchers become iconic representations of the post-timeskip designs.

quotes.text: I'm ready. Time to set sail again!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration after completing his training

quotes.text: You're the first one here, Zoro.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh's surprise at Zoro arriving first

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami refusing the Fake Straw Hats' recruitment offer

themes.description: After two years apart, the Straw Hats begin reuniting with new abilities and matured appearances. Each member has grown individually but maintains their core personality.
themes.symbolism: The post-timeskip designs symbolize growth while the unchanged personalities represent the crew's enduring bonds.

themes.description: The Fake Straw Hat crew exploiting the real crew's reputation explores themes of fame, identity, and the consequences of becoming legendary figures.
themes.symbolism: The imposters represent the burden of fame and how the Straw Hats' legend has grown beyond their control.

themes.description: The episode marks the start of the series' second half, representing a fresh chapter in the Straw Hats' journey toward the New World and their ultimate goals.
themes.symbolism: The new opening narration and theme song symbolize rebirth and renewal of purpose.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro arrives first despite his poor directional sense, showing his determination. His scarred eye and enhanced physique hint at intense training with Mihawk.
keyActions: Reveals post-timeskip appearance with scarred eye

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy completes his training and departs with renewed determination to reunite with his crew and tackle the New World.
keyActions: Departs from Ruskaina after two years
quotes: I'm ready. Time to set sail again!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the leader of the Fake Straw Hat crew, exploiting the real crew's reputation for personal gain.
keyActions: Recruits pirates including Caribou and Coribou
quotes: I'm Monkey D. Luffy, and I'm recruiting strong pirates to conquer the New World!

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode adapts only portions of Chapter 598 (pages 1-3, 6-16, 19, 23-24), with remaining content appearing in Episode 518.
Boa Hancock's dress is colored red in the anime instead of blue as shown in the manga color spreads.
When Luffy departs Ruskaina, the red tiger from his animal group is missing in the anime.
In the manga, Fake Sogeking fires multiple shots that miss. In the anime, his shot would have hit if the door hadn't closed.
The anime omits Sanji flipping off the okamas when he departs their ship.
The scene with Marguerite is extended to show her preparing to defend herself against a giant lion before Luffy intervenes.
Brook actually sings some lyrics of 'Bone to Be Wild' in the anime, while the manga only shows him performing.

trivia.fact: Episode 517 marks the first episode of the post-timeskip era and the beginning of the series' second half, making it one of the most significant episodes in One Piece history.
This is the first episode to use the opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani, which became iconic for the post-timeskip era.
The episode features a new opening narration that reprises the original narration about Gold Roger's execution, but updated for the new era.
This is the first episode to use the third set of eyecatchers, featuring the Straw Hats' post-timeskip designs.
The episode achieved an 11.1% TV rating in Japan and ranked 2nd for its time slot.
This was the first One Piece episode to air on Toonami since 2017, marking a significant milestone for the English-speaking fanbase.
Zoro arriving first at Sabaody despite his notorious poor sense of direction became an instant fan-favorite moment and spawned numerous memes.
Brook's song 'Bone to Be Wild' performed in this episode is a reference to the rock song 'Born to Be Wild' by Steppenwolf.
